description: From Latin incongruus, from in- (“not”) + congruus (“congruent”).

adjectives.description: incongruous (comparative more incongruous, superlative most incongruous)

entries.meaning: Not similar or congruent; not matching or fitting in.
examples: Ardent suns had likewise tanned his face till it was swarthy as a Spaniard's. The yellow mustache appeared incongruous in the midst of such swarthiness.

entries.meaning: (mathematics) Of two numbers, with respect to a third, such that their difference can not be divided by it without a remainder.
examples: 20 and 25 are incongruous with respect to 4.
